page.title: 02The town of Crediton
page.content: Crediton is a town of approximately 6,000 people. It is situated between two hills on the main route from Exeter to Barnstaple. In the summer Crediton benefits and suffers from the flow of{holiday-makers}through its high street. There are two County Primary, one private (preparatory) and one Comprehensive{school}for the 11-19 range. Crediton's{shops}cater for most of the needs of its inhabitants and those who live in the surrounding countryside. A good deal of{employment}is available in local industries, but many people work in Exeter. There was a{settlement}at Crediton in{Saxon}times. It is thought to have been the birth-place of St. Boniface.}
